dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST and BIRT walk along a corridor towards their gate..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: And - here’s the bigger question, why do it? You don’t need it. Your career is in great shape. It would spread you across three continents, and jeopardize the other shows. Is it true Channel 9 in Australia want you to do another season of your talk show for them?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: And London, too?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes...but that’s London and Australia. This would be..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: ++swhat? They reach the queue for their plane.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You wouldn't understand - you were never part of the show in New York. But it’s indescribable. Success in America is unlike success anywhere else. And the emptiness, when it’s gone...and the sickening thought that it may never come back. There’s a restaurant in New York...called Sardi’s. Ordinary mortals can’t get a table. John, the place was my canteen.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: You know, I’d be happier if I’d heard some kind of vision you had for this interview - or anything... Suddenly a FAN approaches FROST, holding a 10x8 picture o FROST from satirical T.V. show “That Was The Week That Wa days. FROST signs.  50 51 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 23.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: +..but I don‘t. I just hear a man doing it because it would create headlines or give him a place at the top table. And that's what makes me nervous. Very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: And you do ‘nervous’ so beautifully.

dialogues.speaker: FAN
dialogues.text: (mimicking) “Hello, Good evening, and Welcome.” The FAN goes. FROST stares after him...

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You know, I don’t actually SAY that. FROST and BIRT show their boarding cards to a STEWARDESS, enter the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 747 carrying FROST and BIRT roars along the runway, a takes off, climbing into the air..

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747. DAY
dialogues.text: Mid-flight. BIRT is asleep. FROST reads the Financial Tim smoking a large cigar. A STEWARDESS arrives with a bottle champagne. Fills FROST’s glass. FROST looks across the aisle to see the attractive DARK- HAIRED WOMAN reading. Her champagne glass is untouched... He thinks for a moment, then.. FROST (cont’d) You don't like champagne?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Not on aeroplanes.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 24.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes. Dehydrates one terribly. The trick is to have a glass of water on the go too. The way the Viennese serve coffee,

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I‘ve never been to Vienna.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You'd like it. It’s like Paris without the French. A silence. FROST looks over... FROST (cont‘d) Good book? She lifts the cover. It’s MIDDLEMARCH.. FROST (cont’d) Middlemarch. They say the town in the book was based on the place I grew up.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Which was?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Kempston. In Bedfordshire. Although, the truth is, we pretty much lived everywhere in our time. My father was a Minister.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Oh really? Which party?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: The Methodists. CAROLINE laughs. An attractive, infectious smile.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Caroline.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: David.  52

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 25.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Yes, I know, David Frost. (smiles to herself) “Hello, Good Evening, and Welcome” CAROLINE gets to her feet, and walks off. FROST’s smile fades. FROST follows her up to..

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747. DAY
dialogues.text: The bar area up. FROST and CAROLINE take seats..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I heard an interview with you, recently. On the radio. You were giving it from back of your Rolls Royce.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: (correcting) «Bentley.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: +-on the phone! They said you were a person who defined the age we live in.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You and Vidal Sassoon. FROST's face falls.. eee

dialogues.speaker: OF
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 26.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: What made you exceptional, they said - was that you had achieved great fame without possessing any discernible quality.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: How kind.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: And that you fly around a great deal.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: It‘s true.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I like to keep busy.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I find it more interesting than keeping still.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Because..there's plenty of time for that when I‘m dead.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: What a strange thing to say. CAROLINE looks at him closely..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You have sad eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Do I?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Has anyone told you that before?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 27.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Are you a sad person?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Let‘s talk a little bit about you.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Of course, You feel more comfortable asking questions.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: How right you are. Why are you going to LA?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: It's where my boyfriend lives.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Pity.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: With his new girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: PROST
dialogues.text: Things are looking up.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I'm going to pack together my belongings. And ship them back home.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: To London.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Monte Carlo. It’s where my ex-husband lives. FROST turns..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You're complicated. CAROLINE smiles, takes this as a compliment..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Thank you. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Am I complicated?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 9/24/07 27A.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Are you single. It’s what you were asking, isn't it?  53 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 28,

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes....I am.... (evasive) -..technically...I think. The captain's voice comes over the tannoy.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: This is your captain speaking. You may have noticed we’ve now begun our final descent into Los Angeles. If you could return to your seats, and fasten your seat-belts.. A STEWARDESS tells FROST and CAROLINE to return to their seats.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: FROST and CAROLINE come down the stairs..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: How about you? Why are you going?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: To meet Richard Nixon.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Really? They say he has the most enormous head. But the sexiest voice. Where is he now? In some dark, underground cave? Licking his wounds?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Actually no. In his rather smart beachside villa in California.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Richard Nixon? In a beachside villa? How... incongruous.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes. It's called ‘Casa Pacifica.’ I'm told he still drives a golf buggy with the Presidential crest on it.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: How interesting. It must be hard to let some things go. They reach their seats, where JOHN BIRT is waking up..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 54-57 58 59 60 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 29.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You can come, if you like?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: To meet Nixon?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Are you sure? I'd love that. ‘Ping’, the fasten seat-belt sign lights up..

dialogues.speaker: PROST
dialogues.text: My office will call you first thing in the morning! And send a car. With a phone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blue Mercedes pulls up at the President's house. SECRET SERVICE BODYGUARDS keep watch outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON looks through a crack in the blinds to see FROST getting out of his car. NIXON stares at FROST’s fashionable clothes. The ease of smile. The beautiful girl on his arm. A flicker behind NIXON‘s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON, BRENNAN and SWIFTY LAZAR emerge from the house.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: You found it okay?  61 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 30.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you, Mr. Frost.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: And you, Sir. May I present Caroline Cushing.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Miss Cushing.. NIXON looks down. Notices CAROLINE is barefoot..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: The house. It’s so beautiful. And romantic.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Would you like a little tour? Stretch your legs after the journey?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Oh, I’d love that. CAROLINE puts on her shoes, NIXON, clearly enchanted, lea CAROLINE away. FROST and BIRT shoot a look at one another good start. They notice they are being watched by SECRET SERVICEMEN. Their smiles fade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON is showing FROST, BIRT & CAROLINE round the house. BRENNAN and SWIFTY LAZAR follow..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: --this is the office where Brezhnev and I had our summit. Brezhnev sat there, Gromyko there, Dobrynin there. We talked for nine hours straight. FROST sees framed photographs of NIXON with world leaders shoots a smile at CAROLINE. Then notices BRENNAN is watch him.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: After the meeting, as a souvenir of the visit, I remember we had a Lincoln specially made. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: 30A,
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 31. NIXON (cont'd) Dark blue, cherry wood, leather. All the trimmings. We got inside for the photographers. Brezhnev and myself — when, next thing I know, he starts the engine. BIRT sees NIXON’s desk, scattered with books, philosophy, economics, memoirs. Yellow-pads with notes. Memos. Elaborately hand-written.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Now, the first rule of political life is you never let a President get behind the wheel of a car. Ever. We're not used to doing anything for ourselves - let alone drive. And the Chairman, the way he put his foot down, my guess is the last thing he drove was a tractor on a Ukrainian potato farm.. CAROLINE looks out of the window - sees a woman in the gardens, talking to groundsmen. NIXON’s wife. PAT NIXON.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Anyway, he drove us out, through the estate. Finally we got out to a remote point on the coast out there, overlooking the sea. And he turned off the engine. And we talked. For two hours straight. Most politicians have tragedy in their early lives. I lost two brothers to tuberculosis. He watched his father die from the cancer he caught in the steelworks. He was a sad man. But a noble adversary. NIXON turns to face FROST, BIRT and CAROLINE. The tour ha come full circle.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: But I wouldn’t want to be a Russian leader. They never know when they are being taped. An awkward silence. NIXON turns, looks at FROST..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: So, until March, then. I look forward to it.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. President. So do I.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 32.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I‘ve never been challenged to a duel before. I guess that’s what this is.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Well, not really...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Of course, it is. I like that. NIXON takes FROST’s hand. The grip is suddenly hard. Vice like.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: No holds barred...no holds barred. FROST smiles nervously, withdraws his hand. He is about t go, when SWIFTY calls him back..

dialogues.speaker: SWIFTY
dialogues.text: Oh, Mr. Frost? Before you go..? There is still the small matter of the.. SWIFTY gestures, miming signing a cheque..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: of course. I do beg your pardon. He gets out his cheque-book, starts writing...

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Two hundred thousand dollars... NIXON notices something in FROST’s demeanor.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I do hope that isn‘t coming out of your own pocket. A nervous smile..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Believe me, Sir, I wish my pockets were that deep. {changing subject) Made out in the name of..?

dialogues.speaker: SWIFTY
dialogues.text: (correcting) ‘Irving Paul Lazar.’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FPROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 32A.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: ‘Richard M. Nixon’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 33. NIXON takes the cheque...

dialogues.speaker: SWIFTY
dialogues.text: Will you give me the cheque, Sir?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? The cheque is for me..

dialogues.speaker: SWIFTY
dialogues.text: I know. But I am your agent. From NIXON’s uncomprehending look..

dialogues.speaker: SWIFTY
dialogues.text: Believe me, this is the customary procedure.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: But it makes no sense....I could just deposit it...take it to the bank...

dialogues.speaker: SWIFTY
dialogues.text: Mr. President, I'll take care of it.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: But..but..

dialogues.speaker: SWIFTY
dialogues.text: Will you give it to me - please! SWIFTY prizes the cheque from a reluctant NIXON. NIXON, f moment, locks quite forlorn..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON leads FROST, CAROLINE, BIRT et al out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Well, goodbye. (shaking hands) Mr. Frost. Ms. Cushing. NIXON notices CAROLINE has a camera..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Would you like to take a photograph?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Yes, I'd like that very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 34. NIXON beckons MANOLO then he, FROST and CAROLINE all pose a photo. ‘Flash’, the camera pops.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: There. You can put that in your apartment in New York and all your liberal friends can use it as a dartboard.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm living in Monte Carlo at the moment.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Really? She exits. NIXON watches CAROLINE go, then takes FROST aside...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Take my advice. You should marry that woman.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes. Lovely, isn’t she?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: More important than that - she comes from Monacec. They pay no taxes there. NIXON smiles..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Good bye.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Goodbye.. NIXON and BRENNAN watch as FROST, CAROLINE, BIRT walk off The PRESIDENT waves. Then, after a beat..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I betcha it did.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Come out of his own pocket. Y’know, he couldn’t look me in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) — 8/24/07 35.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: I hear none of the Networks are biting. Without the Networks, the ad agencies don‘t want to know. If you ask me, there's a good chance this whole thing will never happen.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Really? So that meeting we just had - might have cost him two hundred thousand dollars?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: correct.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Had I known that, I might have offered him a cup of tea. BRENNAN laughs. They watch FROST reach his car.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Did you notice his shoes?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Italian. No laces. What do you think? My people tried to get me to wear a pair like that.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: I think a man’s shoe should have laces, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Yes, I do. Personally, I find those Italian shoes quite effeminate. NIXON clears his throat. A little disappointed. He had clearly liked the shoes.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Quite right. NIXON turns and walks back to the house..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A network CHIEF sits behind his desk..

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK CHIEF
dialogues.text: Why would an American Network hire a total outsider? Someone who's already had his own show cancelled, incidentally. .?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST listens on a pay-phone. His smile fades..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I see. Well, I’m sorry you feel that way. Obviously I think you’re making a terrible mistake. FROST hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: NBC. That‘s the Networks out. All of them.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Oh, dear. Well, that's the end of that, then. I’m sorry, David.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Not so fast. FROST has a glint in his eye. Already forming an idea.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Where's your adventurer'’s spirit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Plaza Hotel. Fifth Ave, New York. FROST swivels on a chair, smoking a cigar...

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: +»»the idea is we pay for the programme and syndicate it ourselves. Completely by-passing the networks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST is on the telephone, speaking to his creditors in London. .

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Never been done before. Historic stuff. BIRT enters, and signals FROST should wrap up. There are MEN standing in the doorway. FROST wraps up his call.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: +».0f course I'd match any contribution you make. Dollar for dollar. It’s made for you this one, Jimmy. Have a think, and call me back. Hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: David, I'd like you to meet Jim Reston and Bob Zelnick. Our two prospective cornermen.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Delighted to meet you.. BOB ZELNICK, dark haired, genial, early 40's...

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Bob has been Washington correspondent for Public Radio for the past ten years. Is moving to ABC in the New Year.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: The general view is that I’d been wasting my matinee-idol looks on radio. JIM RESTON, whippet-thin, beady-eyed. A complex, feisty persona..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Jim teaches at the University of North Carolina, and is working on a book about the corruption, criminal dishonesty, paranoia and abuses of power of Richard Nixon. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 37A. BIRT (cont'd) (a beat) His second on the subject.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 38.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Fourth.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Delighted to have you both aboard. FROST shakes ZELNICK's hands. But before RESTON shakes, h clears his throat. An awkward moment..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Actually, before I sign on, I would like to hear what you were hoping to achieve with this interview. FROST stops. An incredulous smile..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: What I want to achieve? FROST exchanges looks with JOHN BIRT..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Jim, I‘ve secured 12 taping days, close to thirty hours with the most compelling and controversial politician of our times. Isn’t that enough?

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Not for me. I‘d be giving up a year of my life - leaving my family - to work on a subject matter that means more than you can probably imagine. And the idea of doing all that without achieving what I want to personally - would be unthinkable to me..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: What is it that you want to achieve?

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: I'd like to give Richard Nixon the trial he never had.

dialogues.speaker: PROST
dialogues.text: Well...of course we will be asking difficult questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: “Difficult questions”? The man lost fifteen thousand Americans and a million Indo-Chinese during his administration. He only escaped jail because of Ford's pardon..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes, but equally, going after him in some knee-jerk way, assuming he’s a terrible guy..wouldn’t that only create more sympathy than anything else?

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Right now, I submit it’s impossible to feel anything close to sympathy for Richard Nixon. He devalued the Presidency and left the country that elected him in trauma. The American people need a conviction. Pure and simple. The integrity of our political system, of democracy as an idea entirely depends on it. And if in years to come people look back and say it was in this interview that Richard Wixon exonerated himself, that would be the worst crime of all. Did you know that Mike Wallace is doing a piece on this, and that in the bars around Capitol Hill and Georgetown this entire project is a joke? A stunned silence. Then..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for that Jim. Would you give us a couple of minutes? ZELNICK looks, ‘Me too?’ RESTON and ZELNICK go. INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE -— DAY RESTON and ZELNICK walk out. ZELNICK hisses..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: What are you doing? I went out on a limb for you. Keep that pinko shit to yourself. Some of us actually want this job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 40.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: I do, too. But only if it’s done right. Little Lord Fauntleroy in there - “Sympathy for Richard Nixon?”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving FROST and BIRT alone.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Is Mike Wallace doing a piece on this?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Apparently.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: It isn’t relevant.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: What's the angle? “British talk show host. Good with actresses. Not so good with stonewalling Presidents?”

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: That‘s the general idea.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Right. Well, it’s hard not to feel a little insulted by that. FROST puts on his jacket, then..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Bob‘s obviously a pro. But what are we going to do about Reston?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: The man’s an idiot. Over-emotional. Send him home.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Well, I think he should stay.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I liked his....passion.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 40a.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: He'll drive us all bloody mad.  66 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 41.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Maybe. But sometimes being out of your comfort zone is a good thing. I'm told. ‘Pop, FROST opens a bottle of champagne..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Ask them back in. BIRT brings ZELNICK and RESTON back in. FROST pours champ into glasses..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: To the trial of Richard Nixon!

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Conviction. ZELNICK closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Very well. The conviction of Richard Nixon. FROST raises his glass. People clink uncertainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ballroom of a five star hotel in Houston. A sign outs tells us this is a convention of Texas orthodontists. NIXON in dinner-jacket and tie, speaking on the after-din circuit, perspiring heavily, (and clearly hating every mo of it)..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: »sanyway, I took my seat next to Mrs. Mao at the banquet table. One of the challenges of life as a President is the endless round of cocktail parties...social engagements, banquets...people who know me would tell you that small talk is not one of my strong suits...particularly not in Mandarin...so, Mrs. Mao and I....we just..well, stared at one another. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 67 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 42, NIXON (cont'd) Across the table, Mrs, Nixon and Chairman Mao himself...they stared at one another too...further down, Dr. Kissinger and their foreign minister...they were staring at one...well, you're getting the picture now. Anyway this particular dinner, I don‘t remember exactly the day in the Chinese Communist calender we were celebrating, some uprising in some Mongolian agricultural collective...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘Crash’, NIXON and BRENNAN and two SECRET SERVICEMEN burs through swing doors, walking down a corridor backstage. N is in a fury. Suddenly dark and frightening.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I can't stand it, Jack! Reducing the Presidency to a series of banal anecdotes..I feel like a circus animal. Doing tricks! And I thought I made it clear, I didn’t want to take any questions on Watergate. GODDAMMIT! As soon as it came to question time, all those SONSOFBITCHES ever want to hear about is Watergate! It’s as if all my other achievements have ceased to exist.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Well, you’re going to get your chance to talk about them sooner than you think.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: How? NIXON stops.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Frost got there. He got the money.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: I hear most of it's borrowed - that friends have bailed him out, but the point is we start taping end of March.  68

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 43.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Really?!? NIXON’s anger dissipates. His face wreathed in smiles..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: That's terrific. How much time is devoted to Watergate. .? They walk through doors, and into..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel kitchens. COOKS stops and stare. NIXON is being shown the secure, back way out of the hotel and to the ca park.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: +«-25%. Just one of four ninety-minute shows.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: The other three are divided into..?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Foreign Policy, Domestic Affairs and Nixon the Man.. NIXON stops..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: “Nixon the man?” As opposed to what? “Nixon the horse?”

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: I imagine....it‘s some kind of biographical piece, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: (shudders) I can see it now. The deprived childhood. The father that beat me. The brothers that died, leaving me consumed with “survivor guilt”, Spare me. Still, the fact it’s come together is a good thing, no?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Mr. President, it's fantastic. Frost is just not in your intellectual class. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 BRENNAN (cont'd) You'll be able to dictate terms. Rebuild your reputation. If you ask me... 43A.  69 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 44.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON and BRENNAN walk out into the car park. SECRET SERVICEMEN make sure the area is secure..

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: If this went well, Sir, if enough people saw it and revised their opinions - you could move back East. Way, way earlier than we'd expected.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: I‘m certain,

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Oh, Jack...I like San Clemente, make no mistake. It's a beautiful place. But it'd be good to get back to where the action is. The hunger in my belly is still there. NIXON visibly gets excited, then tails off as they approa the car..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Guess it all boils down to Watergate, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Nothing to worry about. It’s not as if there will be any revelations. That stuff has been combed over a million times by journalists and Congressmen. And still no one’s pinned anything on you.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Still, it's been a while since I spoke about it on record. I'd better start doing my homework. It’d be good to know his strategy. Where’s he staying?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: At the Beverly Hilton.  70 71 72

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 45,

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: The Beverly Hilton, you say? NIXON rummages in his pocket..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I've got the numbers somewhere of a few fellas we could send in. Cubans. With CIA training.. NIXON looks up. Sees BRENNAN’s horrified expression..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Jesus, Jack. It was a joke! BRENNAN stares, then smiles in relief. They climb into th car, which drives off, accompanied by POLICE OUTRIDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN BIRT speaks to the documentary crew..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: As it happens, we took the whole question of security very seriously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRT, RESTON and ZELNICK all sign forms..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: We had strict confidentiality clauses for everyone involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRT hands a box cof research files to a hotel EMPLOYEE w puts them in the hotel safe..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: From day one we kept a locked safe for all our files.  73 74 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Various shots: RESTON, ZELNICK, BIRT and FROST sit in a restaurant over a period of many weeks, working on the interviews, papers strewn all over the table..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Since the ex-President’s name attracted attention we would refer in telexes to ‘the subject’, and in restaurants Nixon would become William Holden or Charlton Heston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESTON takes over the story...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: As for the work? Over the months we divided it into three sections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRT, ZELNICK and RESTON, shirtsleeves and styrofoam, are strategizing. A television plays in the corner..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: +»-okay, how are we going to kick this off..? What should the first question be?

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Birt took Vietnam. Bob took Foreign and Domestic Policy. I got Watergate and the Abuses of Power. And David? We never really saw much of David.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: The first question should be a loosener. Say what a tough time it’s been. Express concern for Mrs. Nixon after her stroke. For the President after his phlebitis. And ask what kind of life he’s established for himself in retirement. 73 74 75

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 46A.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: And the deafening ‘click’ you‘ll hear, Bob, will be forty million Americans switching off their TV's.  76 77

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 Suddenly the television plays breaking news: a second assassination attempt on GERALD FORD...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: (watching TV) Ouch! Take THAT for pardoning Nixon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB ZELNICK takes up the story...

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: Perhaps because I was the eldest, or because I had the darkest hair, I got to play Nixon in our rehearsals.
76 77 RESTON, ZELNICK and BIRT sit in a room strewn with papers files, research materials. ZELNICK sits to one side..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The fellas would throw questions at me, and, based on years of watching and writing about the President, I would anticipate what his line would be..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: On the White House taping system?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK, (AS NIXON)
dialogues.text: Ours was not the first administration to use taping systems. Lyndon Johnson's White House had them. So did Kennedy's..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: On the alleged abuses of power..?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK, (AS NIXON)
dialogues.text: Let me tell you, other administrations were up to far worse..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: The illicit bombing of Cambodia..  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 48,

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK, (AS NIXON)
dialogues.text: Done with the secret approval and support of the Prince of Cambodia against a hostile force that had invaded his country..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: And just for fun. Jack Kennedy. ZELNICK's face darkens, (as NIXON)..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK, (AS NIXON)
dialogues.text: That man screwed anything that moved, fixed elections and took us into Vietnam! And the American people loved him for it! While I worked round the clock in their service, and they hated me! Look, now I’m sweating! Dammit! And Kennedy’s so GODDAM handsome! And blue-eyed! Women all OVER him!! The door opens. FROST and CAROLINE walk in. FROST is dres in tux pants. Jacket and bow-tie in hand. CAROLINE holds newspaper.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Finally! A friend in the American Press! FROST indicates to CAROLINE, who reads from the paper..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Jack Anderson in the Washington Post. “If Richard Nixon was expecting an easy ride in the up-coming interviews with David Frost, it appears he might have made a mistake. Frost has hired a team of “crack investigators” with the aim of forcing him into admissions he has hitherto been unwilling to make.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: "Crack investigators?”

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Can I be ‘Crack One’?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: (eyes widening) Can I be ‘Deep Crack’?  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs} - 8/24/07 48a. Everyone laughs. The phone rings. BIRT picks it up. RESTO approaches FROST - takes him to one side.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 49,

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: David, researching my last book, I was pretty certain Nixon had a meeting with Charles Colson, his darkest henchman, sometime before June 23rd, but I never knew the exact date, so couldn't find the transcript. But if you gave me a week back in the Federal Courthouse library.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: A week? Goodness, Jim. We couldn't afford to lose you for that long..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: If we’re going to nail him in these interviews, we’re gonna need to ambush him. Take him by surprise.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: (pats RESTON‘s back) Den‘t worry. We'll get him anyway. BIRT catches FROST’s eye, covering the phone..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Jack Brennan. He sounds a little emotional. FROST walks next door, (followed by CAROLINE), and picks the phone..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Jack! BRENNAN paces angrily in his San Clemente office. (We intercut between the two locations).

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Watergate.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes, Jack.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Our lawyers want to agree on a definition of the word.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I believe it’s a large hotel and office complex in Washington, Jack.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 50.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. For the interviews. We want to propose that “Watergate” is an umbrella term for everything negative. FROST walks out onto the balcony....

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: What..so all the other domestic charges against him..the Brookings Institute, the Plumbers Unit, the Enemies List..you’re saying that all goes into ‘Watergate’?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: That’s absurd. And a clear breach of the terms of our agreement.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Okay, how would you define Watergate?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: That it covers just that. The Watergate break-in of June 17th and the subsequent cover-up and investigations.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Fine, in which case the deal is off.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Fine - in which case you can expect a lawsuit for something in excess of $20 million in damages and lost earnings.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: The terms of the contract stipulate quite clearly that Watergate take up no more than 25% of the time!

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes - but nowhere does it say that for the rest of the 75% he gets to drone on and sound Presidential. BRENNAN almost chokes..  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 SOA.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: “Drone on?” Jesus Christ! Where’s your respect? Remember who you’re talking about. You media people, you’re so goddammed smug and self-righteous. You know as well as I do, that sixty per cent of what Nixon did in office was right, and thirty per cent might have ended up wrong, but he thought it was right at the time.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: That still leaves ten percent where he was doing the wrong thing, and knew it.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: I guarantee you, if you screw us on the sixty per cent, I’m going to ruin you if it takes the rest of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 51. FROST hangs up, visibly rattled. Thrown. Then walks into room, picking up his tux jacket on a chair..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Fine, David. Fine. FROST and CAROLINE go.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Why the monkey suit?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: David has a film premier he needs to attend,

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: What? The night before we start taping? What‘s the movie?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: ‘The Slipper and the Rose’.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: The Cinderella movie?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: David is the executive producer!

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: The one with Richard Chamberlain singing “Ding, diddy, ding ding?”

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: You don’t think it might be an idea for our interviewer to be rested and focused on the job in hand?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Don't worry. David is a performer of the highest calibre who has been in pressure situations many times before. Come the hour, he’1ll be fine. BIRT exits. RESTON turns to ZELNICK..  78 79 80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 52.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Did he say..”performer"?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: That was the word he used?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: Yes. He said “performer”.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Not ‘journalist’? or ‘interviewer’?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: No, he said ‘performer’.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Out of interest...where are you at this moment. Psychically?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: I am imagining the dust, the darkness, the agony and the unimaginable loneliness of the wilderness I am about to be despatched to by my Washington political colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST’s limousine arrives outside a cinema, with screamin CROWDS waiting. FROST and CAROLINE step out and into an explosion of PHOTOGRAPHERS‘ flashbulbs and REPORTERS questions..

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 73
dialogues.text: INT. CASA PACIFICA - NIXON‘S OFFICE - NIGHT - (1977) 80 NIXON sits in ‘Casa Pacifica’, in his study, preparing fo the interviews with his team of KEN KHACHIGIAN, RAY PRICE FRANK GANNON and DIANE SAWYER..

dialogues.speaker: KHACHIGIAN
dialogues.text: --any opportunity you get, go right to foreign policy, right to Mao, right to Kruschev.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 52A.

dialogues.speaker: GANNON
dialogues.text: Just go right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 53. A knock at the door. BRENNAN bursts in..

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Sir? Something I think you should see. BRENNAN turns on the TV. ON TV: FROST and CAROLINE at the premier, in the flashlig FROST smiling, waving at cameras. A REPORTER calls out..

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Some people in the media have suggested you‘re not the right man for the job. That you'll be too soft on the President. What will you do if he stonewalls you?

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: I shall say so. Again and again..but I should say now, I’m not expecting his approach to be to stonewall. I’m hoping it will that of a cascade of candor,

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: “BR cascade of candor”? From Richard Nixon? You think that’s what you‘1l get?

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: No. It was just a phrase I thought might appeal to you. NIXON watches the TV. Stares at FROST..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Strange fellow.

dialogues.speaker: GANNON
dialogues.text: Started life as a comic, y‘know.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: That right?

dialogues.speaker: SAWYER
dialogues.text: Almost married Diahann Carroll.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: GANNON
dialogues.text: The singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 53A.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Isn‘t she black?  81

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 54,

dialogues.speaker: GANNON
dialogues.text: {patting file) All in the file which we put together as part of our general preparations. GANNON indicates a file on the desk. NIXON stares, then..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: C'mon. Let’s get back to work. BRENNAN kills the TV. ‘ZAP‘, FROST vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESTON, ZELNICK and BIRT are milling around. In silence. Dressed in suits. Clutching files. Pacing nervously. ‘Ping’, elevator doors open. FROST arrives with CAROLINE, FROST kisses her goodbye, then CAROLINE goes. FROST turns his colleagues...

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Shall we? But ZELNICK, BIRT and RESTON are craning necks, watching CAROLINE go..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Gentlemen. .? They walk out to their CAR.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: And for the record, I’m going to be starting with John’s idea - “Why didn‘t you burn the tapes?”

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: No, please God, no. That would be a disaster and open up the whole Watergate thing way ahead of our agreed time. What’s the point of having contractually set specific times to deal with certain subjects if we go and break it with the first question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 54a.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Because this is war, isn’t it? Gloves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) ~ 8/24/07 55.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I like it. It's...‘ballsy’.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Strategically, it‘1ll give us the upper hand. FROST and BIRT get into the front of the car. RESTON and ZELNICK shoot a look at one another. Get into the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SECRET SERVICEMEN wait patiently. A series of cars with darkened windows. The President’s motorcade. Engines runn GANNON, SAWYER, KHACHIGIAN and BRENNAN all climb into car Finally, NIXON, dressed in a dark, blue suit, emerges fro Casa Pacifica, and walks towards the waiting motorcade. He is about to climb into his car, when a VOICE calls out

dialogues.speaker: PAT NIXON
dialogues.text: Wait! Dick? NIXON turns to see his wife, PAT NIXON come up the path towards him. She comes up close. Their eyes meet. An intensity in her lock. In her hand, a white handkerchief. She puts the handkerchief in his top pocket. Another look between them. She straightens his lapel. The she turns around, and walks back into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST‘s car pulls up outside the location. Large trucks a parked outside. TECHNICIANS carrying lights, catering, generators, cables. FROST is immediately besieged by PHOTOGRAPHERS and TV CRE that have gathered outside. (RESTON and ZELNICK go into t house). Suddenly a ripple of excitement from outside. Shouts of " here!", as NIXON’s motorcade sweeps into the street. Blac sedans. Darkened windows.  84 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 56. Doors open. SECRET SERVICE get out. Ear-pieces. Walkie- talkies. Guns in holsters. It’s an impressive, intimidati entrance. Finally, a car door opens and a pair of classic black sho (with laces), hit the tarmac. NIXON gets out of his car, greeted by FROST. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching from inside the house: RESTON stares. Seeing NIX in person for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: ¥’know, I've written four books about him, but this is the first time I’ve actually seen him in the flesh. RESTON stares as if mesmerized at NIXON as he poses for photographers, and walks towards the house..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: He‘s taller than I imagined. And tanned..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: You going to shake his hand?

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: You kidding me? After everything that prick’s done to this country..? FROST and NIXON walk into the house, followed by NIXON’s entourage. FROST turns to face RESTON..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: May I present Jim Reston, one of my researchers,

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Pleasure to meet you, Mr. Reston. NIXON extends his hand. RESTON stares, then inexplicably, hand slowly, involuntarily rises up..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Mr. President. RESTON and NIXON’s hands shake. NIXON and his retinue mov on. RESTON stares in shock. ZELNICK comes up to him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 57.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: That was devastating. Withering. You know, I doubt he’ll ever get over that.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Fuck off. ZELNICK, RESTON and BIRT smile, then walk towards the Fro team ‘observation room’, (a bedroom now filled with TV monitors relaying the footage from the set). They are about to disappear inside, when they look up to their opposite numbers: BRENNAN, KHACHIGIAN, SAWYER and GANNON enter their ‘observation room’. The two teams stop and stare at one another. Eyeball to eyeball. Then go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST and NIXON remain on set, under studio lights, as HA MAKE-UP and SOUND TECHNICIANS make final adjustments..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Before we start, I just want to say how delighted we all are by Mrs. Nixon‘s recovery. MANOLO SANCHEZ brings NIXON a cup of tea on the President China...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Well, thank you. It’s true, she’s much better now, and is getting round to the business of replying to all the cards. Have a guess how many she received? From FROST’s blank look..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: A hundred thousand.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Goodness.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Mostly from schoolchildren. Isn’t that interesting? (a beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 NIXON (cont'd) And from our point of view - I'd just like to say how pleased we are you got this all together.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I understand it’s been quite a struggle.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Well...I...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: How much has it cost? Do you mind me asking? C'mon. Between us.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Very well...two million.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Two million? I didn’t realize we were making Ben Hur, But you've raised it all now?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Not quite. But getting there. Everyone has been kind. And deferred fees.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Not quite everyone. NIXON smiles icily. Then takes out a handkerchief...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I'd like to put a handkerchief here, if I may. Is that out of shot? Contractually..I think..we made a provision that during each question I might dab my upper lip. Which you won't show when you cut it together.. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: You're probably aware of my history with perspiration.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: If you‘re referring to the TV debate with Jack Kennedy in 1960? 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: They say that moisture on my upper lip cost me the Presidency. People who listened on the radio thought I’d won. Television and the close-up. So now they insist I bring my handkerchief and that I have my eyebrows trimmed. A silence..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Do you trim yours?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Of course not. You’re light skinned and have blue eyes. And have no problems with perspiration, I imagine?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Not that I'm aware.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: You were obviously born to be on the tube. A MAKE-UP LADY gives NIXON final touches..

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Sixty seconds everyone.. NIXON clears his throat. He looks down. Then..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Those shoes. They're Italian, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: My shoes..? I believe so.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Interesting. A beat..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: You don't find them too effeminate?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86 87 88 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 60.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I suppose someone in your..ah..field can get away with them. NIXON stares at them enviously, as DAVIS, the STUDIO MANA calls out..

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Five, four, three.. NIXON and FROST focus in anticipation, two athletes waiti for the gun, then DAVIS cues PROST..’Go!’

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Mr. President, we are going to be covering a lot of subjects in a great deal of detail over the course of these interviews, but I'd like to begin completely out of context, by asking you one question, more than any other, almost every American and people all over the world want me to ask: “Why didn’t you burn the tapes?” NIXON stiffens, as if he’d received an electric shock. INT. NIXON TEAM OBSERVATION ROOM — DAY - (1977) 86 BRENNAN looks up. Under his breath..

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Sonofabitch..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZELNICK stares anxiously at the TV monitor which has a cl up of NIXON’s face.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: {under his breath) God-damm-it..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON perceptibly flinches. Stares at FROST. Then, a bare perceptible flicker behind his eyes..  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) — 8/24/07 él.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Mr. Frost, I’m surprised by your question, since we have an agreement, a contractual agreement, I believe, that we would cover Watergate in our last taping session. But if your “viewers” really do have a “major concern”, then perhaps I should briefly respond to it now.. NIXON crosses his legs. Sits back.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: What probably very few people realize is that the taping system in the White House was set up by my predecessor President Johnson - partly to avoid the necessity of having a secretary in every meeting, and partly to ensure there was a record kept of every verbal agreement - no matter how off- the-cuff or casual. Initially, on coming into the White House, I insisted on dismantling the system.. 89 INT. BRENNAN’S OFFICE - SAN CLEMENTE - DAY - (1982) 89 JACK BRENNAN smiles in satisfaction..

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: In boxing, there‘s always that moment, you see it in challengers’ faces. The instant they feel the power of the champ‘s first jab. A sickening moment, when they realize all the pep-talks, and the hype and the months of psyching themselves up has been delusional all along. You could see it in Frost’s face. If he hadn't known the calibre of the man he was up against before the interviews started, he knew it half way through that first answer..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST’s face: staring at NIXON. Visibly shaken.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 62.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: «+I hadn’t liked the idea at all but President Johnson had repeatedly said how crazy it would be to remove the system which he felt was the best way to preserve for history important White House transactions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZELNICK’s heart sinks, watching the monitors..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: So much for our “ballsy” opening..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: You see, since the best advice is almost always of the confidential variety, now the tapes have been made public, people are unlikely ever to feel comfortable speaking in confidence at the White House..they are less likely to offer that advice so in the end it’s the whole political system..and by implication the country that suffers...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: C'mon, David, shut him up! Change the line of attack! Miraculously, as if FROST had heard him...

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: So when did you actually decide, at what moment did you know you were going to resign?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON deals with it effortlessly...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Oh, I remember exactly. It was July 23rd. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 63. NIXON (cont'd) After it was clear the Southern Democrats that were still against impeachment had the screws put on them by the Speaker of the House. That night I said to Al Haig, “That’s it. There goes the Presidency.” Of course, being Al, he tried to talk me out of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON continues talking about GERALD FORD. RESTON turns t BIRT, an imploring look..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: John, do something! This is desperate. Twenty-three minutes on the first question??

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: OK. Let’‘s take a break. Let’s change the tapes.. BIRT gets up and walks out into the set..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRT walks out and calls for a break. Lights come up. NIX gets up from his chair, and is immediately fussed over by HAIR and MAKE-UP. BIRT takes FROST aside..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: What are you doing, David? You've got to stop him rambling.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: It‘s all right - these are just introductory exchanges.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: But this session only lasts two hours - nearly half of it’s gone. And you’re wasting valuable material. The moment he made the decision to resign. We should be scoring points with that..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You want me to switch to Vietnam?  97 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) ~ 8/24/07 64.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: No!! You’ve got to get something out of that resignation night. That was Nixon at his lowest point. A total wreck. On his knees? Praying with Kissinger? Come on. You can nail him with that stuff. Meanwhile: in the other corner, NIXON is with BRENNAN, GANNON, KHACHIGIAN and DIANE SAWYER..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Was that okay?

dialogues.speaker: GANNON
dialogues.text: The best start imaginable.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I didn't sound arrogant, or self- serving?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Not at all. You sounded controlled, even-handed, statesman-like. Continue exactly the same way. Long answers. Control the space. Don’t let him in.. The two TEAMS go back to their observation rooms. FROST a NIXON resume their seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAVIS, (the STUDIO MANAGER), counts down, “Five, four..” NIXON wipes the perspiration from his face. FROST drinks a glass of water. The STUDIO MANAGER cues DAVID..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Reading the account of those extraordinary final days, it seems your most emotional moment was in that heart-to-heart you had with Henry Kissinger. Was that perhaps the most emotional moment of your career?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Yes, it was perhaps as emotional a moment as I have ever had.. NIXON hesitates, a dramatic pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 65.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: --except, well, it’s hard to say what is the most emotional moment, because each is different. I remember the day Eisenhower died..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching on the monitor, RESTON’s heart sinks..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Oh, no, don’t do this..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: And the day I walked my eldest daughter Tricia down the aisle..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: Please, God no..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON continues..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: And the day during the Impeachment hearings when Julie, my youngest, came into my office, threw her arms around me, kissed me and cried. She so seldom cried. She said, “Daddy, you're the finest man I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESTON stares in disbelief...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: "Daddy, you’re the finest man I know?”

dialogues.speaker: NIXON, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: Whatever you do I will support you, just go through the fire a little longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GANNON and BRENNAN smile in delight..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 66.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: This is beautiful! INT. TV SET —- MONARCH BAY - DAY - (1977) 102 FROST has slumped in his chair..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: +-and so there we were, Kissinger and I, in the Lincoln sitting-room, sipping Courvoisier, and together we began to reminisce about some of the great decisions we'd participated in; China, the Soviet Union, the peace settlement in Vietnam - plus domestically, of course, huge strides had been made in racial desegregation, and he said, "Mr. President, I want you to know, it’s a crime you‘re leaving office, a disservice to the peace in the world that you helped build, and history is going to record that you were a great President”. Then his voice broke. Now, I can’t stand seeing someone cry.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: You’re going to see me cry soon.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: And so I started to cry too. But when I say ‘crying’, I don’t mean sobbing or anything like that. But there we were. Two grown men, who’d between them, seen the mountain tops, and many of the great crises of their times. And I put my arm around him, and TI said..”Let me tell you something I’ve never told anyone. Whenever I've had a tough decision to make I’ve come into this room for the purpose of praying. So if you don’t mind, could we just have a moment of silent prayer?” So we knelt down. In front of that table where Lincoln signed the Emancipation Proclamation... FROST looks up to see DAVIS the STUDIO MANAGER hovering..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Is there a problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 67. The STUDIO MANAGER indicates his watch..

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: That‘s time. We're over two hours.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Really..? So soon?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Right..well, Mr. President. I gather our time is up..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Pity. I was beginning to enjoy that.. BRENNAN walks on set, beaming..

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: That was terrific. Both of you. BIRT, ZELNICK and RESTON walk on. Ashen-faced. TECHNICIAN remove FROST and NIXON's microphones..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Funny. I was expecting questions on Vietnam. And we‘d prepared for that, hadn‘t we, Jack..? BRENNAN nods, ‘Absolutely’.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes, so did I..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Guess we just got caught up reminiscing..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Indeed.. Handshakes with FROST..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: The day after tomorrow, then? 10.00.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes, indeed. FROST and NIXON shake hands, then NIXON and his entourage  103 104

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON exits the house to a volley of photographers’ flashlights and journalists’ questions. NIXON smiles..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By contrast: FROST and his team remain inside. In deathly silence.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: There’s no need to say anything..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: David, it was a disaster...

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Not entirely. We can use some of that Kissinger stuff.. But, yes. I’m disappointed too.. FROST raises his hands in a defensive gesture..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: But I wonder..could we possibly spare the post-mortem for now? I don‘t mean to minimize it, it’s just I need to get back to LA to meet some people from ‘Weed Eater’. FROST goes. ZELNICK turns, and stares at BIRT, who avoids eyes, looks down at his notes..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: ‘Weed Eater?’

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: I believe that’s what he said - yes.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: What the hell is ‘Weed Eater?’

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: I believe it’s some form of... (makes whirring noise) ++shorticultural mechanism. One of our sponsors.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 68a.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: ‘Weed Eater?’ What happened to Xerox, General Motors or IBM?  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 69.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: I gather....not all of the Blue Chip accounts have come through. (seeing the bright side) But we have Alpo.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Dog food?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: We've started taping. What are you saying? Are we close? John...?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Look...I suggest you take this matter up with David.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Are we close? BIRT clears his throat..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: I believe we're at thirty per cent.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: To go? Or thirty per cent sold?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Look, you're really going to have to talk to.... Thirty per cent sold.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Jeeee-sus.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: I thought we were fully financed!

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: We were. But the finance was always conditional on advertising sales. And no one expected them to....fall apart like this.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: What's that based on?

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Credibility of the project. What else are advertising sales based on? Silence. BIRT stares at the RESTON and ZELNICK, then..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 70.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Look, I understand your concern, but could I ask you to go a little easier on David in the next couple of days, bearing in mind the extraordinary pressure he’s under. At the moment, he’s effectively paying for it all himself. So he’s in for a lot more here than his reputation.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: And we're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST’s car pulls up. He dashes out. Leaves the car parke a restricted space.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: «..but I thought you made a firm commitment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST rushes up a staircase.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I don’t understand...why this sudden change of heart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST sits alone in the waiting area of modest, uninspiri offices. Exhausted. Hollow-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Well, who's predictions are you basing that on...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST sits with the detached, unmoved EXECS from Weed Eat and pitches the interviews. It’s humiliating. They are clearly not that interested..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 70A.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: But..that’s just madness! It’s Richard Nixon! These interviews will do mid 30's audience share, minimum...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 109 110 lil FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 71. The EXECS are unmoved. Their body language says it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAROLINE is dressed-up to go out. Waiting for DAVID. She watches through a half-open door as FROST is on the phone behind a wall of cigar smoke..

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Jimmy, David...back again like the proverbial bad penny, look - I hate to ask this of a friend...and I know you're already in for more than I asked for.. We CLOSE on CAROLINE’s face. Her voice fades in..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It’s strange...any normal person would just take a rest...or just give up... CAROLINE stares. A flicker of sadness. Then she goes. The door closes. FROST doesn't notice. Carries on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: «I just need you to dig a little deeper..I’m RIGHT up against it now.. INT. CAROLINE’S HOUSE - LOS ANGELES - DAY - (1982) 110 CAROLINE speaks to the documentary crew..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: «..but that would have meant admitting failure. And David doesn’t DO failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flashlights pop as FROST and CAROLINE arrive in Monarch B FROST waves. Big smiles. All confidence. All show.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Failure is for other people.. CAROLINE smiling, too. But we sense beginning to detach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST sits in make-up. Desperately catching up on last-mi reading. Behind him, JOHN BIRT..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: I had a chance to review yesterday's tapes. RESTON and ZELNICK stand outside in the corridor, and are eavesdropping anxiously...

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: And. .?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Honestly? Far too soft, David.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Go on. Beat me, John. Beat me with a stick!

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: I’m serious, David. You’ve GOT to make it more uncomfortable for him! Sit forward! Attack more! If he tails off, bang, jump in with another question. Don’t trade generalizations with him. Be specific. Above all, don’t let him give these self-serving, twenty-three minute homilies.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: And keep your distance before the tape starts running. He was toying with you yesterday. All that stuff about Ben Hur, and struggling to raise the money. Don‘t engage. Those are mind games. Never forget, you‘re in there with a major operator.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST waits on set. Presently, NIXON and All the Presiden Men enter. NIXON walks up to FROST, a confident smile..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Ah, the Grand Inquisitor.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 72a. FROST smiles back. Warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 73.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No. Just your friendly neighborhood confidante. NIXON and FROST shake hands. Are about to take their seat “BANG” ~ a loud bang. One or two voices scream in shock. an instant the President's SECRET SERVICE guys rush into room..

dialogues.speaker: SECRET SERVICEMEN
dialogues.text: Everyone OK? NIXON remains calm. And standing. The STUDIO MANAGER call out..

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Okay - just a lightbulb that blew. NIXON smiles, seeing FROST’s alarm.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: With all these security servicemen around, there’s no need to worry. As a President - you get used to this kind of thing. NIXON and FROST take their seats..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Pleasant evening last night?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Ye-es. Thank you. MAKE-UP and SOUND TECHNICIANS do their final checks..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Did you do any fornicating?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: (visibly thrown) I beg your pardon? In the observation room: BIRT closes his eyes, “Oh, no”, DAVIS, the STUDIO MANAGER, counts down.. ‘Five, four, three..‘ Then cues FROST, who struggles to gather himself  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) — 8/24/07 74.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Mr. President, you came to office promising peace, but no sooner did you get into the White House than US involvement in Vietnam deepened - and the war was prolonged with calamitous consequences. Did you feel you'd betrayed the people that had elected you?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: You know, Mr. Frost, I’m an even— tempered man, but nothing upsets me more than when I hear blame for Vietnam being laid at my door. Vietnam was not my fault. It was my inheritance. Of course, I could have ‘bugged out,’ blamed it on my predecessors, and pulled the troops out early, and very possibly won some Scandinavian peace prize into the bargain, but this was an important test of American credibility. The whole world was watching to see if we have the “character” to see it through. But I believed in the cause. And sometimes what you believe in is the harder path. It could be said I was the last casualty of Vietnam...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRT leans forward..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: .«..Cambodia, come on David.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON MONITOR)
dialogues.text: «and Cambodia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flicker behind NIXON’s eyes..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Yes, and Cambodia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 75.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: An invasion which everyone advised you against. All the Pentagon and CIA intelligence suggested it would fail. So why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Well, first of all, as a result of our incursion into Cambodia, we picked up 22,000 rifles, 15 million rounds of ammunition, 150,000 rockets and mortars belonging to the North Vietnamese, which would only otherwise have been directed onto American soldiers or innocent South Vietnamese civilians. Now, I can’t put a finger on the amount of lives that saved. I just know that as a result, our casualties went down and we were able to step up our withdrawal.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: But one of the principal justifications you gave for the incursion was the supposed existence of the “Headquarters of the entire Communist military operation in South Vietnam”, a sort of “Bamboo Pentagon” which proved not to exist at all.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Now, just a minute....

dialogues.speaker: FROST

dialogues.text: Violent, distressing news footage fills several monitors the set..of devastated Cambodian villages, South Vietname soldiers clinging to the skids of American helicopters.. NIXON watches it. But as soon as the VT tape ends, he tur on FROST. Imperious. Defiant.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Look..it was never US policy to kill civilians, That’s the enemy's way. And if you’re asking the question, do I regret the casualties on both sides in the war? Of course, I do. I experienced real difficulties at home, as you know, as a result. With the universities and so forth. I attended a judicial conference in Williamsburg, Virginia, late in 1970 and as I walked into the hall to make a speech a little girl, I don’t think she was more than 16, broke through the line of people there, and ah...she just spat in my face, just covered my face with spit, and she said, “You are a murderer.” Of course I wiped the spit eff, went in and made the speech. And I was thinking, she was such a pretty girl, but at that moment she was so ugly, and it was the war that had made her so. I lost a great deal of sleep ever that particular incident. And the worry, the responsibility, let me tell you, it can wear you down. But whenever I had doubts, I remembered the construction worker in Philadelphia who came up to me and said, “Sir, I have only one criticism of that Cambodia thing. If you had gone in earlier, you might have captured the gun that killed my boy three months ago. So, in answer to your question, do I regret going into Cambodia? No. I wish I’d gone in sconer. And harder. At that, the STUDIO MANAGER walks on and calls ‘time!' Th lights come up. NIXON and FROST get to their feet. The tw TEAMS walk onto the set.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 76A. A triumphant BRENNAN walks on and effusively shakes ZELNI and BIRT’s hands..  118 119 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 77.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Congratulations, this is terrific! We're getting some great material..! Neither BIRT nor ZELNICK can speak. They stare. Hollow-ey Pale. Traumatized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON and his team leave to popping flashlights, big smil good-natured banter with the NEWSMEN..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By contrast, FROST, BIRT, ZELNICK and RESTON stand in dea silence, as TECHNICIANS wrap up around them..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Better..?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: It was. Unquestionably better.

dialogues.speaker: PROST
dialogues.text: I assumed a more challenging position like you said. Was more conscious of my body language. Asked what I thought were more penetrating questions. And didn‘t allow him to ramble quite as much..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: But his replies were still too long. Ten minutes instead of twenty. And you weren't scoring where you had to. FROST flashes with irritation..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Can we make that ‘we’, Jim? ‘We’ weren‘t scoring where ‘we’ had to? I think that would help..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: And on Cambodia, a development of the war so morally repugnant, so utterly unjustifiable you let him go on and on..and without being challenged, some of his justifications almost sound reasonable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 78,

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Right now, for a liberal American, it's agony. It's like watching a dead man come back to life.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Well - it's still early days. What's next?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Foreign policy. FROST goes.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: Oh, God. The big power stuff? Russia? China? The Middle East?

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: Yes. Why?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: (thinking FROST has gone) If he beats him up like that on Vietnam, what‘s he going to do with his real achievements? But FROST only reached the door. And heard every word.
