dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: The answer was grow by six inches. It was agony to watch. InT. TV SET - MONARCH BAY - DAY - (1977) 120 NIXON in the interviews. Energized. Tanned, confident and statesmanlike. FROST, by contrast, is slumped in his chai Hollow-eyed. Defeated.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: ».ethat’s when Khruschev called me, BEGGING me to intervene...see he and Mao didn’t get along, and he knew that the Chairman would talk to me...no one else...I was the only one Mao trusted personally...man to man...  121 122 123 124 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FROST TEAM watch in depressed silence as NIXON gives masterclass in geo-politics, and the benefits of diplomac

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I remember when it had come to working out the order we would be taping the sessions - I had always argued that we tape the Foreign Policy last.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON, (ON SCREEN)
dialogues.text: «+--detente, as I understand it, or modern diplomacy, or political friendship, is a procedure whereby leaders of the major powers, having gotten to know one another personally over time can settle disputes diplomatically - in conversation - before reaching a flashpoint...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: My reason was simple. Nixon was always going to shine in that arena, and the last thing we wanted was that he take that increased confidence into the all- important abuse of power sessions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Which, of course, is exactly what happened. And when David tried to lay a finger on him, Nixon made mincemeat of him..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ‘Crash’, FROST, BIRT, RESTON and ZELNICK burst out of the house at Monarch Bay, mid-argument..  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) ~ 8/24/07 79a.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: What “revolution”, David? You let Nixon claim this country was in a state of revolution with protestors “bombing” and “assaulting” police officers? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 80. ZELNICK (cont'd) Well, that’s not the way it looked to ME. All I could see was people protesting peacefully and legitimately against the Vietnam War... FROST is heading towards the beach..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: By the end, the Huston Plan was beginning tc sound like a rational response.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry you feel this way. But I simply cannot share your view.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: About any of it, frankly. I thought today was a huge improvement.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Are you nuts? Let me tell you how bad things were today. After the taping finished, I overheard two crew members say..they never voted for him when they had the chance. But if he ran for office again today, he’d get their support. You’re making him look Presidential, for Chrissakes. And forget the trivia! Who cares whether Nixon took the White House bed to Europe when he travelled?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I de.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Well, it’s irrelevant, and just the sort of banal anecdote that would distract at... RESTON stops, tailing off. Stops himself.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: What? A silence.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 gl.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Go on. Say it. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You were going to say “talk show host"?

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Yes. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Look, it’s useless me trying to answer your points. Frankly, I don’t share any of your sense of pessimism or alarm and this ridiculous self- flagellation, in my view, is just...depressing...and threatening to de-rail the whole enterprise. If there is anyone here who really has lost faith, and thinks we are going to fail, they better leave now, or it'll infect everyone else. A silence. Gulls wheel above them. Dive for fish.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No one? Right. Good. Now I suggest instead of festering around the hotel for the next five days, we all go our separate ways over Easter. But before we go..Caroline and I would like you to join us for a little celebratory dinner at Patrick Terrail’s new place. FROST walks back towards the house. ZELNICK holds his hea can’t help laughing...

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: To celebrate what, David? The fact the project is going down the pan? And we're all going to be working at Burger King? FROST turns, a flash of anger..  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) ~ 8/24/07 sla.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: It's my birthday, Bob. I'd like to celebrate my birthday with a few friends.  125 FPROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) ~ 8/24/07 82. With that, FROST turns and walks back to the car. OVER TH music fades in. The sound of festive singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We‘re in the legendary Beverly Hills restaurant. In it’s heyday. A packed party. Squashed in a booth between two beautiful Hollywood types like out-of-place schoolteachers, are RESTON and ZELNICK. blur of naked flesh, as skimpily dressed WOMEN walk past.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: That bad? FROST’s face: a flash of vulnerability. Then he looks up see two GUESTS, and his face bursts into a radiant smile.  126 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 83.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Well, look who it is! Darling, you look wonderful! BIRT and CAROLINE can’t help smiling. Meanwhile, the duet builds to a climax..

dialogues.text: "Frost and Nixon, Frost and Nixon, it’s a situation that’s going to need some fixin'..” We CLOSE on NEIL DIAMOND’s hands...

dialogues.text: INT. CASA PACIFICA - NIXON’S OFFICE - DAY - (1977) 126 Another pair of hands, dancing on piano keyboards.. We're in Casa Pacifica. And the hands belong to NIXON who plays piano, the following day. JACK BRENNAN, DIANE SAWYER, KEN KHACHIGIAN and RAY PRICE when he finishes.

dialogues.speaker: PAT NIXON
dialogues.text: My, what a festive atmosphere. PAT NIXON has entered the room. She walks with a slight l The MEN jump to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: PAT NIXON
dialogues.text: Please, don’t get up. I take it from this the interviews have gone well?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Better than that, Ma’am. It's a shutout. The President is sitting on an 11-0 lead.

dialogues.speaker: PAT NIXON
dialogues.text: Really? PAT NIXON looks over at her husband.

dialogues.speaker: PAT NIXON
dialogues.text: Well, that’s most gratifying. {a polite smile) I’m so glad it’s all gone according to plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 84. PAT NIXON turns, then walks out of the room. Everyone sit Expects the former President to start playing again.. But NIXON‘s expression has darkened. Lost in thought. INT. FROST’S HOTEL SUITE - NIGHT - (1977) 127 FROST is sitting in his hotel-suite. Speaking on the telephone. His voice is low. Hushed. Defeated. Broken. CAROLINE stands in front of the mirror, getting dressed..

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: I see. Is there nothing we can do? Listens. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Really? FROST’s face becomes ashen..

dialogues.speaker: FROST, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Right. Well....thanks for letting me know. FROST hangs up. Badly shaken.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: It’s true. They’ve dropped the Australian show.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Oh, David..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: They felt I needed to ‘re-evaluate my priorities’. Now my producer is worried the London show will follow. I’m in this for everything I‘ve got. And there’s STILL no guarantee it will ever see the light of day. What have I done? What was I thinking? Why didn‘t anyone stop me? They should have physically stopped me. CAROLINE looks at him. Moved. Yet not sure what to do. Ho help. She goes to hug him, but he freezes, does not respo

dialogues.text: Look, let’s stay in tonight. I‘'1l go down to Trader Vic‘s and bring something back. Fish or steak, Which? (MORE)

dialogues.text: oh

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I’ll call from the restaurant. CAROLINE takes a last look at him, and goes. Leaving FROS alone.. He continues to pace up and down restlessly. He stands in middle of the room. Visibly deflates.. It‘s an intensely private moment. His face is long. His e baggy and tired. For the first time his spirit seems brok Presently, the phone rings. FROST stares at it for a while. Cannot face it. Finally h goes to answer it. When he speaks, it’s with a quiet, defeated voice.,

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I'll have a cheeseburger. But the slurring voice at the other end does not belong t CAROLINE.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (ON PHONE)
dialogues.text: Mmm. Sounds good. I used to love cheeseburgers. But Doctor Lundgren made me give them up. Switched me to cottage cheese and pineapple instead. He calls them my Hawaian Burgers. But they don’t taste like burgers at all. They taste like styrofoam, FROST freezes. Immediately recognizes NIXON, speaking fro San Clemente.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON in his study high up in San Clemente. (We intercut between the two locations as necessary)..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I...ah..hope I’m not disturbing.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 86.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: It’s a Friday night. You..ah..probably have someone there..whom you're entertaining..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing? NIXON is flicking through a file on his desk. We notice i full of pictures of FROST.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: A handsome young fellow. An eligible young, bachelor, alone on a Friday night?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: If you must know..I’m preparing for our final session.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Ah, the all-important final session.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: ‘Watergate’. NIXON continues to scan the file. We see newspaper headli about FROST's early career..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: It's a small consolation to me that for the next couple of days, that word will be as much of a millstone around your neck as it has been around mine. Because I guess, the way you handle Watergate will determine whether these interviews are a success or failure. Should I be nervous?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Well, I’m going to give it my best shot.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Quite right. No holds barred. No holds barred. You know, it’s strange. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 87. NIXON (cont'd) We've sat in chairs opposite one another, talking for hours, it seems days on end..and yet I've hardly gotten to know you. One of my people..ah..as part of the preparation of this interview..did a profile of you, and I’m sorry to say..I only got around to reading it tonight. There's some interesting stuff in there. NIXON’s eyes take in childhood photos of FROST, humble beginnings...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: The Methodist background, modest circumstances. Then off to a grand university. Full of richer, posher types. What was it? Oxford?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Cambridge.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Did the snobs there look down on you, too?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Of course they did. That’s our tragedy, isn’t it, Mr. Frost? No matter how high we get, they still look down at us..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I..really..don’t know what you're talking about..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Yes, you do. C’mon. You know exactly. No matter how many awards - or how many column inches are written about you - or how high the elected office is for me - it still isn’t enough, am I right? We still feel like the little man? The loser they told us we were? A hundred times. The smart-asses at college. The high-ups. The well-born. The people who’s respect we really wanted. Really craved. And isn't that why we work so hard now? Why we fight for every inch? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 88. NIXON (cont'd) Scrambling our way up, in undignified fashion, whatever hillock or mountain it is, why we never tire, why we find energy or motivation when any sensible person would lie down, or relax. In the file: articles about FROST's failure in America. T network show being cancelled...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: If we’re honest for a minute. If we reflect privately just for a moment...if we allow ourselves...a glimpse into that shadowy place we call our soul, isn’t that why we‘re here now...? The two of us? Looking for a way back? Into the sun? Into the limelight? Back onto the winner’s podium? Because we could feel it slipping away? We were headed, both of us, for the dirt. The place the snobs always told us we'd end up. Face in the dust. Humiliated all the more for having tried so pitifully hard. Well, to hell with that. We’re not going to let that happen. Either of us. We're going to show those bums, and make them choke on our continued success. Our continued headlines. Our continued awards, power and glory. We're going to make those motherfuckers choke. Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You are. Except only ONE of us can win.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: And I shall be your fiercest adversary. I shall come at you with everything I've got. Because the limelight can only shine on ONE of us. And for the other, it’1l be the ‘wilderness’. With nothing and no one for company, but those voices ringing in our heads. A pause. NIXON sways slightly...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: You can probably tell..I‘ve had a drink. Not too many. Just one or two. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 129 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 89. NIXON (cont'd) But believe me, when the time comes, I‘ll be focused and ready for battle.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I would expect nothing less.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Well, good night, Mr. Frost.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Good night, Mr. President. NIXON hangs up, and disappears into the darkness. At that moment the door opens and CAROLINE enters again..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: With or without cheese? She holds bags containing fast food..

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: I brought burgers. She looks up, notices FROST’s expression...

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: David. .? FROST is deeply shaken. The blood has run from his lips.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: I’ve got to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST is working. His desk is covered in notes. White A4 legal pads. Books. Transcripts. Files prepared by his TEA Various constitutional papers, the Statute with regard to Obstruction of Justice. FROST’s eyes skim across the writing. Close on his PEN‘s as it circles key words. Key phrases. FROST listens to tapes. The President’s voice as he talks COLSON, EHRLICHMAN and HALDEMAN. . FROST pours over transcripts, his pen circling key phrase “I don’t care if they spend five years in jail..”

dialogues.text: 130 131 132 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 90. FROST re-writes questions: re-orders them, numbering them Checking against his team’s predictions of NIXON‘s strate His answers. FROST grows tired: his pen circles various dates. June 20 Suddenly FROST’s eyes come to rest on a name. CHARLES COL FROST drinks coffee. Stares at the name, ‘Colson’ and the date, June 20th. Grabbing at straws now. He checks the time on his clock, then picks up the teleph and dials a number.

dialogues.speaker: FROST

dialogues.speaker: FROST

dialogues.text: A taxi pulls up. RESTON gets out. Carrying bag and briefc INT. dialogues.text: Not yet. ‘Ping’, FROST, RESTON and CAROLINE appear from the elevat

dialogues.text: FROST and NIXON walk towards one another, as technicians final adjustments...

dialogues.text: What phone-call?

dialogues.text: The phone-call to my hotel room? This time it’s NIXON who's thrown..

dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 93.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Looking back over your final year in office, do you feel you ever obstructed justice or were part of a conspiracy to cover-up or obstruct justice? NIXON gathers himself.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: No, I don‘t. And I’m interested...you use the term ‘obstruction of justice’. You perhaps have not read the statute with regard to the obstruction of justice.

dialogues.speaker: PROST
dialogues.text: As it happens, I have.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: You have, you say? Well, then you‘ll know it doesn’t just require an act. It requires a specific, corrupt motive. And in this case I didn’t have a corrupt motive. What I was doing was in the interests of political containment.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Be that as it may, the direct consequences of your actions would have been that two convicted burglars would have escaped criminal prosecution. How can that NOT be a cover-up or obstruction of justice?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I think the record shows, Mr. Frost, that far from obstructing justice - I was actively facilitating it. When Pat Grey of the FBI called me on July 6th, I said, “Pat, go right ahead with your investigation.” Hardly what you'd call obstructing justice.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: That may be. But for two weeks prior to July 6th we now know, you were desperately trying to contain or block the investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 93A.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Now, hang on...  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Obstruction of justice is obstruction of justice - if it’s for a minute or five minutes. And it’s no defence to say that your plan failed. I mean, if I try to rob a bank and fail, that’s no defence. I still tried to rob that bank.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Now, wait a minute, Mr. Frost...there is no evidence of any kind..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: -».the reason there is no evidence is because eighteen and a half minutes of the conversation with Bob Haldeman from this June period have mysteriously been erased.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: An unfortunate oversight. But Bob Haldeman is a rigorous and conscientious note taker. And his notes are there for all to see.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Well, we found something rather better than his notes. FROST produces RESTON‘'s notes..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: There’s one conversation with Charles Colson in particular, which I don’t think has ever been published..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Hasn‘t been published you say?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No, but one of my researchers found it in Washington. Where it’s available to anyone who consults the records..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESTON takes a deep breath..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Okay, baby - here we go. 94. 139  140 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 95. RESTON indicates the TV monitors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON‘s

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Oh, I just wondered if we'd seen it..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: More than seen it, Mr. President, you spoke the actual words. face visibly jolts..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You've always claimed you first learned of the break-in on June 23rd. But this tape, made three days earlier, clearly shows that to be a falsehood. In it, you say to Colson, "This whole investigation rests unless one of the seven begins to talk. That's the problem.”

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: What do we mean by “one of the seven begins to talk"? NIXON is clearly rattled now. He reaches for the handkerc beside the table..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Then moving onto a conversation you had with John Dean on March 21st, the following year, in one transcript alone, in black and white, I picked out, One, “You could get a million dollars and you could get it in cash. I know where it could be gotten”. Two, “Your major guy to keep under control is Hunt”. Three, “Don’t we have to handle the Hunt situation?” Four, “Get the million bucks. It would seem to me that would be worthwhile.” Five, “Don't you agree that you'd better get the Hunt thing going?” Six, "First you’ve got the Hunt problem. That ought to be handled.” Seven, “The money can be provided. Ehrlichman could provide the way to deliver it. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) — 8/24/07 96. FROST (cont'd) That could be done.” Eight, “We've no choice with Hunt but the $120,000, or whatever it is, right?” Nine, “Christ, turn over any cash we’ve got.” FROST looks up at NIXON..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Now, it seems to me, that someone running a cover-up couldn’t have expressed it more clearly than that. Could they?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Look! Let me stop you right there. You're doing something here which I am not doing, and I will not do throughout these broadcasts. You‘re quoting me out of context, out of order.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: You have always maintained that you knew nothing about any of this until March 21st. But in February your personal lawyer came to Washington to start the raising of $219,000 of hush money to be paid to the burglars. You seriously expect us to believe you had no knowledge of that?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: None. I believed the money was for humanitarian purposes to help disadvantaged people with their defences,

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Tt was being delivered on the tops of phone booths with aliases and at airports by people with gloves on. That's not normally the way lawyers’ fees are delivered.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Well, I've made statements to this effect before. All that was Haldeman and Ehrlichman’s business. I knew nothing.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) — 8/24/07 97.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: All right, if Haldeman and Ehrlichman were really the ones responsible, when you subsequently found out about it, why didn’t you call the police and have them arrested? Isn’t that just a cover-up of another kind? NIXON is struggling for air. His face is ravaged..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Maybe I should’ve done. Maybe I should’ve called the Feds into my office and said, “Here are the two men. Haul them down to the dock, fingerprint them and throw them into the can”. But I‘m just not made that way. These men, Haldeman and Ehrlichman, I knew their families. Known them since they were just kids. And I’ve always maintained - what they were doing - what we were ALL doing was not criminal. When you're in office, you have to do a lot of things that are not, in the strictest sense of the law, legal. But you do them because they’re in the greater interests of the nation.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Wait a minute...did I hear right? Are you really saying that there are certain situations where the President can decide whether it’s in the best interests of the nation and do something illegal?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I'm saying that when the President does it, that means its not illegal.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: i‘m sorry..?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: That’s what I believe. But I realize no one else shares that view. FROST leans forward..  141 142 143 144 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 98.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: So, in that case....will you accept, then....to clear the air once and for all...that you were part of a cover- up, and you did break the law? NIXON’s face: in close-up. Staring. Frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESTON, ZELNICK and BIRT lean forward. Stare at the scree

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. We got him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENNAN, GANNON and KHACHIGIAN lean forward. Stare at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! He's going to blow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON stares. Ravaged. Is about to speak, when...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: OK, let’s take a break there! JACK BRENNAN walks onto the set. Calling ‘Time!’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRT, RESTON and ZELNICK bolt upright. Horrified.

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: What! What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: What the fuck’s going on! Is that it? BIRT jumps to his feet, grabs his file, and runs out, followed by ZELNICK...  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 98a.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRT runs out onto the set...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 99.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: A break?!? Are you crazy? FROST throws his clipboard down, visibly irritated...

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: OK. Change the tapes. In the middle of all this, NIXON gets to his feet and qui slips off to his dressing-room.

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: David, can we talk a minute?

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: What the HELL'’s going on, Jack? He was about to blow and you know it!

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Fellas...this is a critical moment in his life..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: We could sue you for this!

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: You deliberately sabotaged the interview. BRENNAN raises his hands defensively...

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: Look...we’re all in this together...I’m sure we can find a solution that works for everyone.. BRENNAN walks out, following NIXON..

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: (calling after him) What are you talking about? What solution? This is an interview. ZELNICK is taken aside by FRANK GANNON, KEN KHACHIGIAN an RAY PRICE.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON’s dressing-room. BRENNAN closes the door behind him NIXON paces in the shadows...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: What did you do? Throw in the towel, Jack? Take pity on me?

dialogues.speaker: BRENNAN
dialogues.text: I just felt..if you were going to make some kind of...emotional disclosure..we should just take a moment to think it through..sketch it out. I just want to impress upon you how crucially important this moment is...and how many potentially devastating consequences unprepared emotional...disclosures could have.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I know. But equally - to go on. And carry on denying it all? A long pause. NIXON thinks, wrestles with a decision..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I appreciate the gesture. He shakes BRENNAN‘s hand..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jack. NIXON turns and walks back to..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the main set. Where FROST is waiting with BIRT and ZELN

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: He's coming back!

dialogues.speaker: ZELNICK
dialogues.text: Be careful, David. They might have come up with something.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: It'll be fine, David. Pick up where you left off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) ~ 8/24/07 100A. FROST stares at NIXON as the PRESIDENT reappears..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 148 149 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DIRECTOR sees FROST and NIXON back in their seats.

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: Okay, everyone! Ten seconds..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST takes his seat opposite NIXON. Not a word is exchan The two MEN stare at one another...

dialogues.speaker: DAVIS
dialogues.text: Five, four, three.. The STUDIO MANAGER cues FROST, who leans in ruthlessly cl Exactly where they left off.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Mr. President, we were talking about the period March 21st to April 30th. About the mistakes you'd made and so on. I’m wondering...would you go further than mistakes? The word that seems not enough for people to understand.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Well, what word would you express?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: All right. Since you’ve asked me.. FROST throws down his clip-board..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: ..there are three things the American People would like to hear you say. One, there was probably more than mistakes. There was wrongdoing - yes, it might have been a crime too. Secondly, I did abuse the power I had as President. And thirdly, I put the American people through two years of agony and I apologize for that. And I know how difficult it is for anyone to admit that - most of all you. But I just feel if you don’t, you’d regret it the rest of your life.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 101A. NIXON’s face: a flicker behind the eyes..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 102.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: It‘s true, I made mistakes. Horrendous ones - ones that were not worthy of a President. Ones that did not meet the standards of excellence that I always dreamed of as a young boy. But if you remember, it was a difficult time. I'd been caught up in a “five front war”, against a partisan media, a partisan House of Congress, a partisan Ervin Committee... But NIXON tails off, as he catches himself...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: But yes, I'd have to admit there were times I did not fully meet that responsibility, and...was involved in a ‘cover up’ as you call it. And for all those mistakes, I have a very deep regret. I still insist they were mistakes of the head, not mistakes of the heart...but they were my mistakes and I don‘t blame anyone else. I brought myself down. I gave them a sword. And they stuck it in...and they twisted it with relish..and I guess, if I'd been in their position, I’d have done the same..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: And the American People?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I let them down. I let down my friends. I let down the country. Worst of all, I let down our system of government and the dreams of all those young people that ought to get into government but now think it’s too corrupt. I let the American people down, and I have to carry that burden with me for the rest of my life. My political life is over. FROST stares at NIXON. Unable to believe what he has just witnessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RESTON speaks to the documentary crew...  150 151 152 153 154 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 103.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: The first and greatest sin of television is that it simplifies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERAMEN, hardened professionals one and all, stare. Unable to believe what they have just seen.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Diminishes. Great, complex ideas..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRT, RESTON and ZELNICK stare at the monitors in their observation room. In silence.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Tranches of time..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRENNAN, SAWYER, KHACHIGIAN and PRICE stare at the monito in their observation room. In silence.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Whole careers..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DIRECTOR, VISION-MIXER, EDITOR and LINE PRODUCER star their monitors, unable to believe what they have just see

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Become reduced to a single snapshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIM RESTON speaks to the documentary CREW..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At first I couldn’t understand why Bob Zelnick was quite as euphoric as he was after the interviews.  155 156 157

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOB ZELNICK shakes hands with BRENNAN and GANNON. Champag pops. Cigars are handed out.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Or why John Birt felt moved to strip off and rush into the ocean to celebrate. An ecstatic JOHN BIRT tears off his clothes as he runs ac the beach, and throws himself into the ocean..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But that was before I understood the reductive power of the close-up.

dialogues.speaker: INT, UNIVERSITY LIBRARY
dialogues.text: RESTON continues his documentary interview..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON
dialogues.text: Because David had succeeded, on that final day, in getting, for a fleeting moment, what no investigative journalist, no state prosecutor, nor Judiciary committee, nor political enemy had managed to get...

dialogues.speaker: A TELEVISION SCREEN
dialogues.text: NIXON’s face in close-up on a television screen..

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Richard Nixon’s face, swollen and ravaged by loneliness, self-loathing and defeat...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: I let them down. I let down my friends. I let down the country...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..filling every television screen in the country.. A quick-fire montage: of TELEVISIONS up and down the Unit States of America, East and West, North and South..  158 159 160 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 105,

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ++«the rest of the project and it’s failings would not only be forgotten. They would totally cease to exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON shuffles out after the interviews. Clearly dazed, h bends down and pats a small dog belonging to a neighbor, muttering...

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Is this what you call a Dachshund? The DOG walks back to his OWNER. NIXON stares, then walks towards his limo. PULL BACK TO REVEAL: this moment is witnessed by FROST, w stands by a window, locking out. In the house: celebrations have broken out all around him but FROST is not celebrating. His face looks almost sad: humble in victory. Filled with compassion. He watches as NIXON gets into his car, door h open by SECRET SERVICEMEN.. »..and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME MAGAZINE and NEWSWEEK both carry pictures of FROST o their covers...

dialogues.speaker: BIRT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: The Nixon/Frost interviews were wildly successful. They attracted the largest audience for a news program in the history of American television, David made the cover of Time and Newsweek mnagazines..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST and JOHN BIRT arrive back at their hotel where a co of JOURNALISTS and PHOTOGRAPHERS are waiting, (we recogni them as some of the same GUYS that gave FROST a hard time earlier)..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 161 162 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 106.

dialogues.speaker: BIRT, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: ---and inspired half the Political Press corps, as hard-bitten and unsentimental a bunch of assassins as you could wish to meet, to call him with messages of contrition and congratulation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN BIRT finishes off his documentary interview..

dialogues.speaker: BIRT
dialogues.text: I believe David saw the former President Nixon just one more time. Before he left for London again, he drove up to San Clemente, to say goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of gulls wheeling. FROST and CAROLINE arrive outside Casa Pacifica. FROST carries a small parcel... NIXON approaches, wearing golf clothes. The two MEN shake hands..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Mr. Frost. Ms. Cushing. Please excuse my..ah..golf outfit. It’s the official uniform of the retired. He smiles embarrassedly..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: So..on your way home?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Into a bright new dawn of fresh enterprises, and challenges..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Let’s hope so. A haunted flicker behind NIXON's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 107.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Good for you. The limelight continues to shine for one of us. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: I..ah..didn’t catch the interviews as they went out. But they tell me they were a great success. I gather the «.ah.. journalists that were so positive about you were not so kind to mee.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes, I was sorry to see that..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: No condolences necessary. I’ve grown to expect nothing else from those sons of whores.. NIXON turns to CAROLINE..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Forgive me, Ms. Cushing. I would have said “sons of bitches”, but Manolo here is a lover of dogs, and hates me to defame animals. MANOLO SANCHEZ arrives, immaculate as always, blazer etc. big, enthusiastic smile..

dialogues.speaker: MANOLO
dialogues.text: Can I get anyone anything?

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Tea? Perhaps some champagne...David? I have some caviar too, which the Shah of Iran sent me..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Are you sure? It’d be no trouble.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: No really. We must be.. NIXON extends his hand..  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 108.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Well, thank you for coming by. You were a worthy opponent.

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Mr. President. They shake hands. FROST turns, is about to go, then..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Oh, I almost forgot. I brought you a present. FROST hands over a box..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Those shoes, you admired. I brought you a pair. NIXON opens the box. Takes a peek inside. Gucci loafers. There‘s something unexpectedly touching about it..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Well, thank you. I’m touched. FROST and CAROLINE go..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Safe trip, now, FROST and CAROLINE turn and walk off. But they haven't go very far, before..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Oh, David. One last thing. CAROLINE indicates she’s going to go ahead and wait. FROS turns, and walks back to NIXON alone..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Those parties of yours. The ones I read about in the papers. Tell me...do you actually enjoy them? FROST smiles, bemused..

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Really? You have no idea how fortunate that makes you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 109. A flicker behind NIXON’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Liking people. And being liked. That..facility you have with people. That lightness. That charm. I don't have it. Never have. Makes you wonder why I chose a life which hinged on being liked. I’m better suited to a life of thought. Debate. Intellectual discipline. Say, maybe we got it wrong. Maybe you should have been the politician. And I the rigorous interviewer,

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Maybe. FROST is about to turn, then..

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Did I really call you that night?

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Did we discuss anything important? FROST thinks, then...

dialogues.speaker: FROST
dialogues.text: Cheeseburgers.

dialogues.speaker: NIXON
dialogues.text: Cheeseburgers? NIXON stares, as FROST turns and walks into the sunset, towards his car and a waiting CAROLINE.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Despite being buried with full honours in 1994, Richard Nixon never again held public office of any kind. NIXON raises his arm, waves at FROST as he drives off...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: His most lasting legacy is that today any political wrongdoing is immediately given the suffix..‘gate’.  163 164 165 FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST and CAROLINE drive along the Pacific Coastal Highwa the open-topped car back to Los Angeles.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: As for David? New York, London and Sydney welcomed him back with open arms. He even got back his table at Sardi’s. FROST smiles. CAROLINE’s hair blows in the wind..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST and CAROLINE walk into a fashionable club in Beverl Hills. Immediately DRINKERS and DINERS get to their feet, applauding - surrounding FROST, congratulating him...

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: His photo would appear in newspapers from time to time. At one party or another. In his crowds of air-kissing politicians, actors and high-fliers, it was tough te tell where the politics stopped and the showbiz started. CAROLINE is left alone. She watches FROST, in his element and smiles to herself. He’s fine. She slips quietly away.

dialogues.speaker: RESTON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Maybe that was the point. Maybe, in the end, there is no difference. And David understood that better than anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIXON sits outside. He looks down at the shoe-box, opens and pulls out his pair of Gucci loafers.. NIXON looks left and right. Checks no one is watching. Then he delicately puts on the shoes, takes a few steps. Gingerly. Unsure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 110A. But as he walks, as he tries them out, from his expressio we can tell,.  FROST/NIXON (Yellow Revs) - 8/24/07 111. He likes them. It's heartbreaking. NIXON carries on walking - into his garden, towards the O - into the long shadows created by the setting sun.. .-and gently his silhouette begins to fade away.

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: The End
